title: A Randomized Double-Blind, Active-Controlled  Study of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome
officialTitle: A Randomized Double-Blind, Active-Controlled  Study of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome
description: This is a randomized double-blind, active-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of MEL-802 (checkpoint inhibitor) in patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome. The study will enroll approximately 545 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 19-79 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Irritable Bowel Syndrome
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
